summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing efforts to identify victims of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell and the Victim Specialists (VS) who assisted them. The emails propose methods to compile accurate lists and contact information for victims and their attorneys, referencing victim notification letters and case numbers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the discussion regarding victim identification and notification efforts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein as a subject of the discussion regarding victim identification and notification efforts.

connections.description: Both are referenced together as the subjects of the victim notification and identification efforts discussed in the email chain.

events.title: Internal FBI discussion on Epstein/Maxwell victim identification
events.description: FBI Victim Services Division staff exchange emails proposing methods to identify victims of Epstein/Maxwell and the Victim Specialists who assisted them, including pulling VNS letters and case files.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively working in September 2021 to identify victims of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The discussion involves retrieving Victim Notification System (VNS) letters that were sent to victims' attorneys, which would contain the names of the assisting Victim Specialists (VS).
The emails reference using case numbers (NY, MM, etc.) and cross-checking victim names in the FBI's Sentinel system and VS monthly reports (VSATT) to compile accurate lists.
The correspondence indicates a request originated from a U.S. Attorney's Office (USAO), and there is mention of notifying FBI Headquarters Office of General Counsel (HQ OGC) about this request.
